div.p: Work-wise? Background, background could influence work-wise I mean it took me 2 years just to get a cleaning job, I’d actually go and see
jobs advertised in stores, in shops, go fill it out then I’d get a letter saying oh we haven’t got any jobs at the minute
literally walk in there the week after and the advertisement is still there and it was down to name on the paper, my name isn’t
like a John Smith but yeah I would say that sort of held me back a bit because of that. I even had some friends, some African friends,
that had English names and they were told you know their parents gave them English names on purpose for that reason because
they could see in hindsight whereas I never understood at the time but now I can see why yeah so but yeah I would say that held me back a bit.
I do have that day where I do like give up after the first hurdle, it’s the second day I start picking myself up and it is down to
people saying small things like “you know you’ve got to try again?” or “you know you are good at it?” and I do take those things on board
and they will stick with me and I will try again so yeah again having a good family and surrounding yourself with good people
to keep telling you, to encourage you, to do better it’s no different to when I tried to go for promotion with the fire fighting job
2 years ago and I was sort of, I sort of failed it, well I wouldn't say failed it, I didn’t pass it, and I was there questioning myself
“look am I really good for the job?” and people would say “no you’ve got to keep trying” so that’s what I’m doing again I’m going for it at this minute in time.
